page.title: 14LOVE HALL - KILWINNING
page.content: {LOVE MEMORIAL HALL Francis Love stayed in Kiwinning many years ago. He decided to emigrate to America to earn money. He emigrated to the New World under the assigned passage scheme between the wars. He left penniless and made his money by becoming a glazing contractor. He donated $ 100 to build a hut or hall to be named{"The Love Memorial Hall". This was to be in remembrance of his brother William who was killed during the war. He agreed that to every additional pound gained by the Corsehill people he would add another pound to the collection. The Hall now provides recreation for Corsehill people. Recently they have built a new bowling green. Most people like it.
